channel.title: Free forums for a legit website?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I've got a question.. Or maybe I'll end up asking more than 1 question, I don't know, but look. Seeing as how my last attempt at starting an online computer fanatic community didn't work out exactly as planned (200+ members, but for some reason there were a lot of accounts made from the same IP addresses), I'm thinking of giving it another go. New website, new forums, new everything. I'm probably still going to just use a free website hoster for the time being until it really picks up with people. So now that I think of it, I've got 3 questions: 1. What free website hoster should I use that supports MySQL and PHP and isn't shitty? 2. What free forum should I use? On my previous website, I used SMF. And when I say "what free forum should I use", I don't mean "websitename.smfforfree.com", I mean the downloadable kind of forum that you upload to your website and can freely edit as you please. [Please give reasons for why I should use that free forum] 3. Would it be a good idea using one of those customized pimped out themes, or just sticking with basic, maybe even the default theme provided? The forums are going to be mainly for computer fanatics, gamers, and programmers, but anyone will be welcome.
inb4 flaming for "advertising" when I haven't even made said website yet :P

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

I plan on using SMF for now, although I’m unsure if I should use SMF 1.1.13 or SMF 2.0 RC5

Read full topic

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Well Reines used punbb with RSCD, I wouldn’t know how he came upon it, Reines put in some effort to help punbb development so he has been a developer for sometime now. I believe last year he took on the roll as lead developer. Fluxbb is the latest development which I would recommend for anyone. Should help them out After all he helped me out.

Read full topic
item.source: Free forums for a legit website?

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:12, topic:383073”]Wait, you mean an old member from MoparScape helped make FluxBB?

Hmm. SMF vs. phpBB vs. FluxBB
What to choose…[/quote]

SMF would be my choice again because of the amount of users it has. If you have a problem with the software then you will find an answer easier then you would with most other forum software because chances are a 1000 other people have ran into the same problem.

Although you could help out reines and pault by using fluxbb.

Read full topic

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

A good free web hoster is x10hosting.com. It gives you PHP myAdmin, MySQL, cPanel, and a domain ofcourse.

Get PHPBB for a downloadable forum, its free and open source.

To be honest, pick a custom one from the ones on PHPBB’s site but download a decent 1 that isnt colorful but 1 that has 1 color but different shades of the same color.

Read full topic
item.source: Free forums for a legit website?

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Interesting… Promising… Do you think there’s a way to set a limit to how many accounts can be made per IP for SMF or PhpBB forums?

item.source: Free forums for a legit website?

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Ego Sir Ego
item.description:
@Sir_Ego wrote:

I just put a forum up a few weeks ago on 000webhost.com. I used phpbb its very simple. If you run into any problems pm me!

as for the domain: I found dot.tk very usefull. Its a free domain, basically if you have mywebsite.site44.net you can change it to mywebsite.tk. Also, the reason they were from the same ip was that someone decided to spam them. Make sure you use captcha when you get people to sign up. Im not sure if smf offers this, but I do know that phpbb does.

Read full topic
item.source: Free forums for a legit website?

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

I used 000webhost and SMF before. The only problem I had with 000webhost was the FTP, but then it got fixed.
*edit: And another problem I had with 000webhost and still have is that I frequently get database errors

I knoow I knoow, it’s just that if the website fails and only gets maybe 20 members in a year, then buying the domain seems kind of like a waste.

Read full topic
item.source: Free forums for a legit website?

item.title: Free forums for a legit website?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I use 000webhost and I think they provide free mysql databases and whatnot. In terms of forum software I would use SMF because it’s pretty easy to configure, use, and administrate.

If you really want a successful website though you need to get a paid domain.

Read full topic
